comments.author: legui79@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

I use Apple Aperture 3 to manage my photos, put titles and keywords in them...
Aperture seems to encode characters in a weird way.
When I upload my photos on Flickr, accents make the text go crazy, not only in the titles and descriptions of my photos, but also in the Flickr titles.
The problem then spreads in other tabs and also affects characters without any accent.

I asked a friend of mine who is on Windows, he also has problems, less visible than mine, only the tremas appeared to be misplaced.
He uses : Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; fr; rv:1.9.1.4) Gecko/20091016 Firefox/3.5.4 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I export photos with titles, keywords... from Aperture 3, then upload them to Flickr
2. Whatever the page on Flickr (which should be displayed with UTF-8), characters go crazy.
3. When I edit the text on Flickr, characters still go crazy while typing.
4. Problems then occur in other tabs.

Actual Results:  
Characters seem to be replaced by others, some are stepped over by other characters...
Whatever the character encoding I try to select, the display is still messed up.

When I edit the text on Flickr, characters still go crazy while typing but are correctly saved (copy/paste check of the actual and updated text on other software).

But the problem doesn't occur on other browsers (tried on Safari & Opera).

When I copy/paste the wrongly displayed text, each software on which I paste the content displays it correctly.

Expected Results:  
Display the text correctly !

See the screen cap for a clearer explaination.
comments.creator: legui79@gmail.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 538948
How the characters are displayed

This is how characters are displayed after I upload images exported from Aperture 3. The content is correct : if I copy/paste the content in other software, it is correct. When I edit the content, the textboxes are still displaying the characters badly, but the content is ok too.
comments.creator: legui79@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: This is how characters are displayed after I upload images exported from Aperture 3. The content is correct : if I copy/paste the content in other software, it is correct. When I edit the content, the textboxes are still displaying the characters badly, but the content is ok too.

comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.text: http://www.flickr.com/photos/44257665@N07/ is showing correctly for me in Firefox 3.6 and 7 using UTF-8 encoding. Did you fix them in another browser or does this only appear on the edit screen? Can you attach one of the pictures you upload that causes the issue?
comments.raw_text: http://www.flickr.com/photos/44257665@N07/ is showing correctly for me in Firefox 3.6 and 7 using UTF-8 encoding. Did you fix them in another browser or does this only appear on the edit screen? Can you attach one of the pictures you upload that causes the issue?

(In reply to comment #2)
> http://www.flickr.com/photos/44257665@N07/ is showing correctly for me in
> Firefox 3.6 and 7 using UTF-8 encoding. Did you fix them in another browser
> or does this only appear on the edit screen? Can you attach one of the
> pictures you upload that causes the issue?

It happens on my FF4.0.1 on Mac OS X 10.5.8, and happened less dramatically on my friends' Firefox 3.5.4 on WinXP (he noted tremas on "r" in the displayed title of the photo and in the keywords).

On my computer, the problem occurs in the layout and also in the input boxes.
Actually, lately, whatever text saved in my metadata is incorrectly displayed as soon as there is an accent. The same content copied/pasted elsewhere is displayed correctly.

In the other browsers I tried, I had nothing to do, everything was ok. I made those tests so that I could see if the culprit was FF4, Flickr itself, or Aperture. Apparently, it's a mutual fault between FF4 and Aperture 3.

I'll join a photo of mine and a screenshot of my friend's screen too.

Thanks a lot for checking this :)
comments.author: legui79@gmail.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> http://www.flickr.com/photos/44257665@N07/ is showing correctly for me in

> pictures you upload that causes the issue?

It happens on my FF4.0.1 on Mac OS X 10.5.8, and happened less dramatically on my friends' Firefox 3.5.4 on WinXP (he noted tremas on "r" in the displayed title of the photo and in the keywords).

On my computer, the problem occurs in the layout and also in the input boxes.
Actually, lately, whatever text saved in my metadata is incorrectly displayed as soon as there is an accent. The same content copied/pasted elsewhere is displayed correctly.

In the other browsers I tried, I had nothing to do, everything was ok. I made those tests so that I could see if the culprit was FF4, Flickr itself, or Aperture. Apparently, it's a mutual fault between FF4 and Aperture 3.

I'll join a photo of mine and a screenshot of my friend's screen too.

Thanks a lot for checking this :)
